comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: Mapped using this 1906 LOC map. This was "The Creation". It was built for the St. Louis Fair in 1904 and opened at Dreamland in 1907. Quote from Coney Island: People's Playground: "'Creation' was staged under an enormous blue dome. It depicted the six days of the Creation as described in the Book of Genesis and concluded with an allegorical tableau representing the creation of man. The arched portal of 'Creation' was supported by the outspread wings of an angel, sculpted in the form of a female figure with breasts bared, standing thirty feet tall. Its facade dominated the park's perimeter along Surf Avenue.

comment.author: 29056926@N02
